Camus: I need a quick prompt to start my day. How should I approach it?
Seneca: I just got frustrated by a long customer service hold time. Help me log this quickly.
Epicurus: I want to log a small, simple moment of pleasure from my day.
Aristotle: I saw someone act very generously today. I want to log the virtue I spotted.
Nagarjuna: I want to do a quick reflection on impermanence right now.
Socrates: Something happened at work that felt deeply paradoxical. Can we reflect on the absurdity?
DeBeauvoir: I need a quick check: was I authentic today?
Hooks: What is one small thing I can do today to practice 'love in action'?
